citation.article-title: Haloglycomyces albus gen. nov., sp. nov., a halophilic, filamentous actinomycete of the family Glycomycetaceae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Haloglycomyces [Ha′lo.gly.co.my′ces. Gr. n. hals salt; N.L. masc. n. Glycomyces a bacterial genus name; N.L. masc. n. Haloglycomyces a salt-(loving) Glycomyces-like bacterium].
Aerobic, Gram-positive, halophilic and filamentous actinomycetes.
Aerial mycelium develops well on most media tested and branched substrate mycelium fragments into short or elongated rods (approx 0.45 mm in diameter).
Contain meso-diaminopimelic acid as the diamino acid.
The whole-cell sugar pattern consists of ribose, xylose and glucose.
The menaquinones are MK-9(H4), MK-9(H2), MK-8(H4), MK-10(H4) and MK-10(H2).

The polar lipid pattern consists of phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylinositol, phosphatidylinositol mannosides, two unknown phosphoglycolipids and one additional unknown phospholipid.
Major cellular fatty acids are iso-C16 : 0, iso-C17 : 0 and anteiso-C17 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 60.8 mol% (HPLC).
Phylogenetically, the genus is a member of the family Glycomycetaceae.
The type species is Haloglycomyces albus.
